title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message:
Customer said it just went dead; board is in pretty good condition although the DCIn board was dusty.

Here's what I have so far;

PPBUS 8.19
ACOK = 3.3 to 3.7 always moving.
PP3v43_G3H = 3.4
SMC_RESET_L = 3.34

R7005 is going up and down 16.3v to 16.7v

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message: 8.19V on PPBUS means that SMC is probably not running. Is charger light going from green to orange?

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message: There is no light on the charger.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message: SMC not running, so probably has crap under it or died.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message:
Now that I look really closely I can actually see residue up the one side of the SMC and going under it. :(

Will keep till I get a stencil for it.

Thanks Duke.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message: Just some flux and heat may bring it back, do not fully reflow just let the flux cook a bit.

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message:
Just did that and it fixed it. :o

I have never fixed a board by doing a "reflow bro" ever before, thought it was a myth.

Mark solved please. :)

title: [SOLVED]820-3437 - No green light.
message: good job! Always try flux under it or reflow first replacing is a not so fun job lol
